hypothesis_content.title: Meme Coin (PEPE/DOGE) Volatility Surge as BTC Drops
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL or BEAR regimes, a sharp, high-volume down day in BTC (-4% or more) will trigger a subsequent 2-day surge in meme coin volatility (PEPE, DOGE) disproportionate to their price move, creating a scalp opportunity via long volatility strategies.
hypothesis_content.rationale: When BTC sells off, speculative capital often flees to sidelines. In the immediate aftermath, the most speculative assets (meme coins) experience violent, directionless swings as weak hands exit and volatile traders attempt bottom-fishing, leading to a predictable short-term volatility expansion.
entry_conditions: BTC has a daily close down >= 4% on above-average volume
Next day, enter a long volatility position on PEPE or DOGE (e.g., via a straddle) at the open, selecting the coin with higher relative volume the prior day

exit_conditions.take_profit: Close position after 2 days at the close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: If the chosen meme coin's 2-day realized volatility is less than 1.5x its 10-day median vol at the 2-day close (i.e., no surge occurred)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The median 2-day realized volatility of PEPE and DOGE following a >=4% BTC down day does not significantly exceed (by a factor of 1.5x) their median volatility in all other periods within the same regime.
